coax.translation[0].definitions[0].defin: to persuade someone to do something that they do not want to do by talking to them in a kind, gentle, and patient way
coax.translation[0].definitions[0].examp: ‘Please, Vic, come with us, ’ Nancy coaxed.
We had to coax Alan into going to school.
We watched the bear coax its cubs to enter the water.
Firefighters managed to coax the man down from the roof.
coax.translation[0].definitions[1].defin: to make something such as a machine do something by dealing with it in a slow, patient, and careful way
coax.translation[0].definitions[1].examp: He coaxed a fire out of some dry grass and twigs.
